CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 8, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "Youths Mourn Loss of Pal - John Cannon (center), who was killed last Friday night in an accident en route from North park, was buried Wednesday afternoon from the home of his parents on Monticello Street....On the right, John's best pals, Richard Britton, Gerald Horsely, Harold Penn, Jesse Ball [Bell], John Thompson and William G. Nunn Jr., serve as pallbearers, while other youths look on. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pallbearers, including Jesse Bell, John Thompson, and William G. Nunn Jr. in foreground, and Richard Britton, Gerald Horsley, and Harold Penn carrying casket of John Cannon out of the Cannon home, Monticello Street, Homewood
